column2: ?       In this role, the successful candidate    will be working alongside Partners across the M&A teams to offer Transaction Advisory Services to financial institutions and infrastructure operators.          You will work closely with Energy / Power / Technology companies, private equity firms and investments banks to deliver technical due diligence services on buy side, sell side and project financing deals.       The ideal candidate will also support the successful delivery of ERM proposals and projects in line with our vision, values and our strategic imperatives by:       Adhering to all ERM and client requirements, specifically those related to H&S and governance       Identifying opportunities for evolving services in line with client needs       Identifying follow-on sales opportunities in respect of designated projects.       Contributing to achieving sales target by supporting Account      Management team and Business Units.       ERM aims to build an "inclusive culture" by identifying, acquiring, developing and retaining a highly skilled and high performing workforce that reflects the diverse global marketplace in which we operate, regardless of gender, ethnicity, religious preference, sexual orientation, physical attributes, and educational background.                 Job Description              M&A within ERM Global has a core technical team of over 50+ technical consultants delivering technical due diligence out of EMEA, USA and APAC.          We often work in close collaboration with our global ESG and EHS due diligence teams, to provide a holistic due diligence service to our client.          Due to increasing client demand in India, we are looking to expand this offering further within the technical service line, based out of India.          ?     As a Principal Consultant, you will be expected to:       Deliver proposals, which will include development of our company profile, scopes of work, scheduling and commercial terms;     Manage and successfully deliver large, complex and/or multidisciplinary consulting and due diligence projects and/or specific deliverables or phases of work on larger, more complex or higher complexity programs.     Lead projects that provide our clients with a technical, operational and business plan evaluation of their proposed investment on infrastructure assets;     Lead the coordination of typical project deliverables such as Q&A submission, management sessions, client meetings and report delivery;     Work effectively across technical communities within ERM and subcontractors who are identified as Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to support project delivery and client interaction; and     Complete internal development tasks to improve the functionality of the Transaction Advisory service line.     Lead, manage performance, inspire and mentor personnel for overall success of technical teams, where required.     Understand the interrelationships between ERM practices and policies and how these are applied within the business model(s).     Establish strong working relationships with clients through project delivery and face to face meetings     Take direction and achieve objectives with minimal oversight.     Participate in site inspections to project sites.               Job Requirements and Skills          To apply for this role at ERM, you should provide evidence / demonstrate the following essential skills, and desirable skills / attributes where possible.         Essential           A solid academic background with an engineering bias (for example, Civil Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Electrical Engineering).       Minimum 12 years of technical consulting, engineering, or operational experience during your career within the energy / power / infrastructure / technology sectors.        Strong technical skills and the ability to identify risks and opportunities within large amounts of technical documentation.     Previous experience with Technical Due Diligence.     Must have experience with site visits, site inspections and technical discussions, relating to points such as asset integrity, operational performance, management systems or business plans.     Must be able to promote and execute quality work, and ensure high standards are being achieved by yourself and the team.     Must exhibit advanced report writing and presentation skills. Experience in a client facing role.     Must have experience assessing asset integrity and performance (HSE, maintenance, availability, etc.)     Management of previous external client projects or experience in a client facing role.     The ability to manage or assist with complex project delivery coordinating multiple workstreams into client deliverables.     Demonstrates excellent organisational skills, self-motivation, self-sufficiency and the ability to work successfully in a fast turnaround team environment.     Experience reviewing EPC contracts, Financial Models, design and specifications, budgets for industrial projects           Desirable            Corporate finance qualification.     Interest in domestic and overseas travel to perform site visits when required.     Knowledge of current, reasonable costs associated with Capex (Capital Expense) and Opex (Operational Expense) for engineering assets / projects.     Familiar with decarbonization strategies and technologies.     Experience reviewing EPC contracts, Financial Models, design and specifications, budgets for industrial projects.

column2: The    Oracle Procure to Pay Consultant    will be responsible for enabling and facilitating the day-to-day use of Oracle Fusion Procurement Cloud across Edgio s diverse portfolio of businesses      The Oracle Fusion Procurement to Pay Business System Solution Specialist will use their expertise and experience to empower a decentralized stakeholder community to take full advantage of Oracle Fusion Cloud procurement capabilities to rapidly buy the services needed to run their business            Essential Functions:              Functional and Technical hands-on experience in Oracle Fusion Procurement Cloud.      Customize and configure Oracle Fusion applications to align with business needs and process requirements.      In this role will act as a Subject Matter Expert for the Oracle Procurement, Payables, Payments, Sourcing and Contracts Cloud modules supporting the design, configuration, validation and realization of the modules delivering a solution that meets the company objectives by combining industry best practices, product knowledge, and business acumen      Procurement Cloud features and functionality, including regarding contract terms and contractual details that could facilitate or hinder implementation of resulting agreements and potential catalogs into Oracle.      Facilitate the conversion of contracts and agreements originating externally from the Oracle platform, whether initiated by the Global Procurement team or independent stakeholders, to conform with Oracle Fusion Cloud Procurement Contract standards.      Administer the setup and configuration of agreements within the Oracle system, ensuring seamless integration for stakeholders to utilize Self Service Procurement functionalities in acquiring contracted services.      Advise and creation of Smart Forms to facilitate the repeated requisition of certain products and services; personally design, implement, deploy, and maintain Smart Forms based on stakeholder requirements.      Serve as an initial point of contact for stakeholders needing support for straightforward administrative functions (e.g., updating approval routings, adding/changing supplier representatives contact information, updating suppliers Oracle Fusion Cloud Business Classification data); provide excellent, timely client service in the resolution of requests, either directly or in consultation with Financial Technology team, to ensure efficient day-to-day operational procurement.      Interface with Legal, Corporate Shared Services, and other internal support organizations to address questions pertaining to the use of Oracle Fusion Cloud Procurement Contracts and custom catalogs.      Provide periodic and ad hoc reporting out of Oracle Fusion Cloud regarding procurement-related activities.      Other analytical, operational, and administrative responsibilities as assigned by manager.              Required Hands on Experience in Oracle Fusion Procurement Cloud:            Core Purchasing, Sourcing, Contracts, Self Service Procurement, Supplier Portal, and Supplier Qualification Management.            Qualifications:                ** Looking for candidates who can join within 30 days **                Experience and Education (minimums):              Bachelors degree required; MBA preferred; Associate degree may be considered with significant work experience.      3-4 years of experience using Oracle Fusion Procurement Cloud to manage procurement contracts, catalogs, purchase requisitions/purchase orders, and/or sourcing projects.              Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:                  Experience in a client service role with responsibility for direct client interaction and problem resolution.      Ability to work self-directed in fast paced, matrixed, collaborative environment; self-motivated, proactive, independent, and responsive, requiring limited supervision; excellent multi-tasking and prioritization skills; highly attentive to details.      Knowledge of strategic sourcing and procurement functions, with experience working with procurement professionals or in a procurement role.      Demonstrated project management skills with experience leading multiple, concurrent projects.      Strong written and verbal communication skills, with ability to interact with and influence a wide variety of audiences, including senior executives; must be fluent in English.      Strong client service mindset.            Our First Team is important to us. Here are some of the benefits you can expect:            Competitive Compensation: Base pay and benefits that are designed to be equitable and market competitive.      Rewards for Total Performance: Incentive programs that provide exceptional rewards for exceptional performance.      Generous Employee Referral Bonus Award Program.      Our remote-first model enables you to work where you are personally most productive.      A diverse and global workforce.

column1: SAP Financial Contract Accounts ( FICA ) Analyst
column2: Description - We are seeking a skilled and experienced SAP FICA to join our team and contribute to the successful implementation, maintenance, and enhancement of the SAP FICA module. As an integral member of our finance IT team, candidate will play a crucial role in managing and optimizing financial contract accounting processes, ensuring accurate billing, payments, and revenue recognition. Expertise in SAP FICA will be instrumental in supporting the organization's financial operations and delivering exceptional services to our business partners. Responsibilities: SAP FICA Configuration: Utilize in-depth knowledge of SAP FICA module to configure and customize the system to meet the organization's financial contract accounting requirements. Ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and accounting standards. Billing and Invoicing: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including billing and collections, to design and implement efficient billing and invoicing processes. Ensure accurate and timely billing of customers and business partners. Revenue Recognition: Develop and maintain revenue recognition rules and procedures in SAP FICA. Monitor revenue recognition processes to ensure proper accounting treatment and compliance with accounting principles. Collections and Payment Processing: Oversee payment processing activities and collections processes in SAP FICA. Address any payment-related issues and work to optimize collections efficiency. Integration with other SAP Modules: Work closely with SAP functional consultants and IT teams to integrate SAP FICA with other relevant SAP modules, such as SAP FI, SAP AR, and SAP SD, SAP SCM to achieve seamless data flow and end-to-end process integration. Issue Resolution and Support: Provide expert-level support to resolve SAP FICA-related issues and incidents. Troubleshoot and analyze problems, proposing effective solutions to ensure system stability and optimal performance. Testing and Documentation: Perform comprehensive testing of SAP FICA configurations and enhancements. Document processes, system changes, and user guides for reference and knowledge sharing. Continuous Improvement: Identify areas for process optimization and system enhancements. Propose and implement best practices to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of financial contract accounting processes. End-User Training: Conduct training sessions for end-users to promote proper usage of SAP FICA functionalities and enhance end-user competency. Compliance and Audit Support: Collaborate with internal and external auditors to provide relevant documentation and ensure compliance with financial regulations and company policies. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Information Technology, or a related field. 7 to 12 years of total experience Proven experience working with SAP FICA module, including configuration and customization. Strong understanding of financial contract accounting processes and revenue recognition principles. Knowledge of integration points between SAP FICA and other SAP modules. Prior experience in billing, collections, and payment processing within an SAP environment. Analytical mindset with excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively interact with cross-functional teams and end-users. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team-oriented environment. Project management skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously. SAP FICA certification (optional but preferred). Shift - No shift premium (India)

column1: GN - SC&O - S&P - Procurement Transformation - Consultant
column2: Sourcing and Procurement  Analyst/ Consultant  Find endless opportunities to solve  our clients' toughest challenges, as you work with  exceptional people, the latest  tech  and leading companies across industries. Practice: Supply Chain and Operations, Industry Consulting,  Global  Network  I Areas of Work: Sourcing and Procurement ,  Supply Chain Management  |  Level: Analyst/ Consultant |  Location: Gurgaon, Delhi, Mumbai,  Bangalore |  Years of Exp: 2-4  years Explore an Exciting Career at Accenture Are you an outcome-oriented problem solver? Do you enjoy working on transformation strategies for global clients? Does working in an inclusive and collaborative environment spark your interest?  Then,  is the right place for you to explore limitless possibilities. As a part of our  practice, you will help organizations reimagine and transform their supply chains for tomorrow-with a positive impact on  the business ,  society  and the planet. Together,  let's  innovate, build competitive advantage, improve business, and societal outcomes, in an ever-changing, ever-challenging world. Help us make supply chains work better, faster, and be more resilient, with the following initiatives: Deliver sourcing and procurement engagements  in the areas of strategic cost reduction, sourcing optimization, procurement transformation, intelligent procurement using tools such as Ariba, Coupa, IVALUA, Zycus and Jaggaer, responsible and resilient procurement, mergers and acquisitions for clients, across industries and geographies. Key activities including but not limited to-  Identify, evaluate and prioritize sourcing opportunities  through in-depth spend analysis, market research, and so on.  Support execution of various stages  of strategic cost reduction, zero based budgeting and operations value transformation programs.  Support implementation of procurement solutions including requirements gathering, technical design definition,define test scenarios & scripts  to ensure that the configured solution meets clients' requirements and be comfortable working with application developers & managing multiple stakeholders  Design sourcing and procurement operating model including organisation structure, processes & technology enablers aligned to traditional & emerging business priorities such as responsible sourcing principles, net zero emission targets etc  Define and execute sourcing optimization initiatives  such as indirect sourcing and cost take-out, direct sourcing and should-cost modeling, category management, and so on.  Support in business development activities  such as responding to proposal requests, conducting roadshows/demos, staffing management, people engagement, asset development and so on.  Bring your best skills forward to excel in the role: Ability to define and implementprocurement operating models impacting procurement organization, processes & technology landscape  Ability to define and execute end-to-end sourcing & procurement processes including  category management & procurement analytics, supplier management, sourcing, contracts & order/goods receipt/invoice management  Ability to develop business case for procurement transformation initiatives such as  implementation of source-to-pay solutions (egAriba, Coupa, Ivalua, Zycus, Jaggaer and so on), operating model changes etc  Excellent data analytics and data interpretation and presentation skills Ability to solve complex business problems  and deliver client delight  Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills  Cross-cultural competence  with an ability to thrive in a dynamic environment  Read  more  about us. Qualification Your experience counts! MBA from Tier-1B Schools and BE/BTech from Tier-1 engineering institutes Good understanding of sourcing and procurement fundamentals coupled with 2-4 years of consulting and industry experience in sourcing and procurement across one or more of the following:strategic cost reduction, sourcing optimization, procurement transformation including implementation of procurement solutions, intelligent procurement, responsible and resilient procurement, mergersand acquisitions Experience with digital sourcing and procurement solutions such as Ariba, Coupa, IVALUA, Zycus, Jaggaer, GEP and so on - either in implementations or as an end user Experience in a consulting firm and global exposure is desirable Knowledge of business intelligence tools such as PowerBI, Tableau and SQL, would be an additional advantage What's  in it for you? An opportunity to work on

column2: ?       In this role, the successful candidate    will be working alongside Partners across the M&A teams to offer Transaction Advisory Services to financial institutions and infrastructure operators.          You will work closely with Energy / Power / Technology companies, private equity firms and investments banks to deliver technical due diligence services on buy side, sell side and project financing deals.       The ideal candidate will also support the successful delivery of ERM proposals and projects in line with our vision, values and our strategic imperatives by:       Adhering to all ERM and client requirements, specifically those related to H&S and governance       Identifying opportunities for evolving services in line with client needs       Identifying follow-on sales opportunities in respect of designated projects.       Contributing to achieving sales target by supporting Account      Management team and Business Units.       ERM aims to build an "inclusive culture" by identifying, acquiring, developing and retaining a highly skilled and high performing workforce that reflects the diverse global marketplace in which we operate, regardless of gender, ethnicity, religious preference, sexual orientation, physical attributes, and educational background.                 Job Description              M&A within ERM Global has a core technical team of over 50+ technical consultants delivering technical due diligence out of EMEA, USA and APAC.          We often work in close collaboration with our global ESG and EHS due diligence teams, to provide a holistic due diligence service to our client.          Due to increasing client demand in India, we are looking to expand this offering further within the technical service line, based out of India.          ?     As a Principal Consultant, you will be expected to:       Deliver proposals, which will include development of our company profile, scopes of work, scheduling and commercial terms;     Manage and successfully deliver large, complex and/or multidisciplinary consulting and due diligence projects and/or specific deliverables or phases of work on larger, more complex or higher complexity programs.     Lead projects that provide our clients with a technical, operational and business plan evaluation of their proposed investment on infrastructure assets;     Lead the coordination of typical project deliverables such as Q&A submission, management sessions, client meetings and report delivery;     Work effectively across technical communities within ERM and subcontractors who are identified as Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to support project delivery and client interaction; and     Complete internal development tasks to improve the functionality of the Transaction Advisory service line.     Lead, manage performance, inspire and mentor personnel for overall success of technical teams, where required.     Understand the interrelationships between ERM practices and policies and how these are applied within the business model(s).     Establish strong working relationships with clients through project delivery and face to face meetings     Take direction and achieve objectives with minimal oversight.     Participate in site inspections to project sites.               Job Requirements and Skills          To apply for this role at ERM, you should provide evidence / demonstrate the following essential skills, and desirable skills / attributes where possible.         Essential           A solid academic background with an engineering bias (for example, Civil Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Electrical Engineering).       Minimum 12 years of technical consulting, engineering, or operational experience during your career within the energy / power / infrastructure / technology sectors.        Strong technical skills and the ability to identify risks and opportunities within large amounts of technical documentation.     Previous experience with Technical Due Diligence.     Must have experience with site visits, site inspections and technical discussions, relating to points such as asset integrity, operational performance, management systems or business plans.     Must be able to promote and execute quality work, and ensure high standards are being achieved by yourself and the team.     Must exhibit advanced report writing and presentation skills. Experience in a client facing role.     Must have experience assessing asset integrity and performance (HSE, maintenance, availability, etc.)     Management of previous external client projects or experience in a client facing role.     The ability to manage or assist with complex project delivery coordinating multiple workstreams into client deliverables.     Demonstrates excellent organisational skills, self-motivation, self-sufficiency and the ability to work successfully in a fast turnaround team environment.     Experience reviewing EPC contracts, Financial Models, design and specifications, budgets for industrial projects           Desirable            Corporate finance qualification.     Interest in domestic and overseas travel to perform site visits when required.     Knowledge of current, reasonable costs associated with Capex (Capital Expense) and Opex (Operational Expense) for engineering assets / projects.     Familiar with decarbonization strategies and technologies.     Experience reviewing EPC contracts, Financial Models, design and specifications, budgets for industrial projects.

column1: SAP TRM (Treasury and Risk Management) Consultant
column2: Squirrel Softech Services Pvt Ltd  is looking for SAP TRM (Treasury and Risk Management) Consultant  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey        We are seeking a highly skilled SAP TRM Consultant with a minimum of 3 years of experience to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of SAP Treasury and Risk Management module and its integration with other SAP modules such as FI (Finance) and MM (Materials Management).        Responsibilities:       1. Configure, implement, and maintain SAP TRM module to meet business requirements.   2. Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their treasury management needs and translate them into system requirements.   3. Provide expertise in SAP TRM functionality including Cash and Liquidity Management, Transaction Manager, Market Risk Analyzer, and Hedge Management.   4. Design and execute test scenarios to ensure the quality and accuracy of system configurations.   5. Provide end-user training and support during system implementations and upgrades.   6. Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to SAP TRM module.   7. Stay updated with the latest SAP TRM releases and best practices to continuously improve system functionality and efficiency.   8. Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth integration between SAP TRM and other SAP modules.   9. Document system configurations, processes, and procedures for knowledge sharing and future reference.        Requirements:       1. Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance, or related field.   2. Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience with SAP TRM module implementation and support.   3. Strong understanding of financial instruments, risk management principles, and treasury operations.   4. Experience with SAP S/4HANA Finance is highly preferred.   5. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.   6. Proven ability to work independently and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.   7. SAP certification in Treasury and Risk Management is a plus.   8. Ability to travel occasionally for project implementations and client meetings.
column11: Interpersonal skills, SAP, Treasury management, Treasury operations, Financial Instruments, Market risk, Test scenarios, Liquidity management, Risk management

column1: Advisory - Deals - Business Valuation - Senior Associate
column2: A career in Deals Valuation, will provide you with the opportunity to help organisations unlock greater value from existing assets and ongoing capital expenditures as well as new acquisitions, investments, and complex corporate arrangements     We focus on a series of services, such as acquisition and disposal valuation advice including deal pricing and negotiation support, strategic value consulting for improvement of corporate and capital management decisions, financial modelling and value analysis     In short, upon being a member of our team, you will support clients to make profound strategic decisions, better conduct business transactions and decisions, appropriately allocate capital investment, and satisfy regulatory requirements with professional skills and in-depth industry knowledge     As a Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution.            PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:             Develop new skills outside of comfort zone.     Act to resolve issues which prevent the team working effectively.     Coach others, recognise their strengths, and encourage them to take ownership of their personal development.     Analyse complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations.     Use multiple sources of information including broader stakeholder views to develop solutions and recommendations.     Address sub-standard work or work that does not meet firms/clients expectations.     Use data and insights to inform conclusions and support decision-making.     Develop a point of view on key global trends, and how they impact clients.     Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties.     Simplify complex messages, highlighting and summarising key points.     Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.                             Activities to be performed :         Support projects on valuation of businesses for raising capital, purchase price allocations, goodwill impairment etc.     Work on building and reviewing financial models for discounted cash   flow and market approach.     Prepare company, industry and economic reviews for valuation reports.     Identify comparable companies and compute various transaction   related multiples.     Use comparable companies to compute weighted average cost of capital (WACC)     Obtain training on the relevant databases, acquire knowledge required   to use the databases efficiently     Organize research findings into meaningful deliverables     Carry out other ad-hoc research based on instructions provided     Ability to analyze and anticipate client requests, interpret asks and   act according to expectations     Good reasoning and analytical ability     Good understanding of databases (CapitalIQ, Bloomberg,   ThomsonOne etc.)     Sound financial concepts     Provide input on best practices and process optimization   opportunities     Churn out varied work requests in short turnaround time.     Capable of designing new research approaches which enhance quality   and productivity     Good working knowledge in MS Office tools     Effective verbal and written communications skills     Self-motivated and capable of working both independently and in a   team     Self-starter with ability to multi-task and constantly reprioritize         Education/qualifications:         CA/CFA/MBA/Bachelor or Masters degree in any discipline

column2: As a Senior Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:     Use feedback and reflection to develop self awareness, personal strengths and address development areas.   Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities, coaching them to deliver results.   Demonstrate critical thinking and the ability to bring order to unstructured problems.   Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current industry or sector trends.   Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance.   Know how and when to use tools available for a given situation and can explain the reasons for this choice.   Seek and embrace opportunities which give exposure to different situations, environments and perspectives.   Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing and connecting with others.   Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality relationships.   Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.   Job Overview      - Knowledge of key valuation methodologies for business entities and intangible assets, including Income, Market and Asset/Cost approaches, including business enterprise valuation, impairment testing and purchase price allocation;   - Good written and verbal communication skills including preparing memoranda and/or reports that communicate research findings and recommendations concisely, confidently and effectively;   - Ability to conduct in-depth client, industry and market research;   - Proactively seeking guidance, clarification and feedback on assigned projects;   - Use of Microsoft Office, specifically Excel forpreparation, manipulation and analysis of large data sets;   - Works effectively as part of a diverse delivery team and recognizes the value of multiple perspectives.     Job Description:     - The job is of a Valuation Analyst where the candidate should have a fair knowledge of the various valuation methodologies like Income Approach (DCF Method) and Market Approach(GPCM and GTM method) and the valuation methodology of Intangible Assets mainly Customers, Technology and Trade name.   - The valuations under Purchase Price Allocation (ASC 805); Goodwill Impairment (ASC 350) and Stock Based Compensations (ASC 718) is done for financial reporting purposes.     Requirements:     - Level of experience - good   - Education/qualifications ??B.Com Graduate and CFA Level 2 candidate   - Industry experience ??IT, Software and Pharma Industry   - Technical capability ??Valuation Concepts and methodologies around Business Valuation and common stock valuation.   - Key Personal attribute ??Goodtechnical and communication skills

column2: This pivotal position resides within our Talent Solutions division, where we have established a strong partnership with one of our valued clients      The role of Netsuite Administrator is external to our internal operations at Myers-Holum, focusing exclusively on the dynamic needs of our client      As part of our Talent Solutions arm, this role plays a crucial role in managing and optimizing our clients NetSuite platform, ensuring seamless integration with various business processes and systems      This role requires strong accounting knowledge, project management skills, and the ability to drive initiatives      By serving external needs, this position contributes directly to our commitment to providing tailored and specialized solutions to our trusted clients while maintaining the high standards synonymous with the Talent Solutions arm of our organization        Key Responsibilities:        Manage and maintain NetSuite to ensure optimal performance and functionality, troubleshooting issues as they arise.      Lead NetSuite-related projects including integrations with payroll, expenses, and warehouse vendors. Administer user roles, permissions, and access controls to ensure data security and compliance.      Assist in project management activities related to third-party vendors and consulting teams engaged in NetSuite projects. Strong accounting knowledge with expertise in accounting processes such as sales tax and financial reporting.      Experience leading NetSuite-related projects and implementing system enhancements.      Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence stakeholders.      Experience with cost accounting is a plus.      Familiarity with Paycom, Brex, and RF Smart is a plus.      Collaborative team player with a proactive and go-getting attitude. column2: Project Role : Business Process Designer Project Role Description : Analyze and design new business processes, monitoring and providing feedback on process performance. Collaborate with business users to identify and define detailed product requirements and use cases. Facilitate process redesign, serving as a liaison to the business community while advising on all change aspects.  Must have skills : SAP Project System (PS) Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Bachelors in Technology or Science Summary :As a Business Process Designer, you will be responsible for analyzing and designing new business processes, monitoring and providing feedback on process performance. Your typical day will involve collaborating with business users to identify and define detailed product requirements and use cases, facilitating process redesign, and serving as a liaison to the business community while advising on all change aspects.  Roles & Responsibilities: Collaborate with business users to identify and define detailed product requirements and use cases. Analyze and design new business processes, monitoring and providing feedback on process performance. Facilitate process redesign, serving as a liaison to the business community while advising on all change aspects. Conduct process assessments and identify areas for improvement, recommending solutions to enhance process efficiency and effectiveness. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Strong experience in SAP Project System (PS). Good To Have Skills:Experience in SAP S/4HANA, SAP Activate methodology, and SAP Solution Manager. Experience in business process analysis, design, and optimization. Strong understanding of project management methodologies and tools. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in SAP Project System (PS). This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification Bachelors in Technology or Science
